Class.name: DLS.HTTP.OutboundAdapter
Class.Description: Modifies EnsLib.HTTP.OutboundAdapter to allow setting of content type used when making %Net.HTTPRequest

Property.name: ContentType
Property.Description: Content Type Header to be used with HTTP request.

Property.name: CredentialsFallback
Property.Description: Fallback credentials to use in case primary credentials rejected

Parameter.name: SETTINGS
Parameter.Description: These are the production settings for this object

Method.name: SendFormDataArray
Method.Description: Send a <var>pOp</var> request ("POST","GET" or "PUT") to the configured Server, Port and URL, sending form data to the named form variables. <var>pFormVarNames</var> is a comma-separated list of form variable names to use. For each name in the list, a <var>pData</var> argument should be supplied. The <var>pData</var> argument is an array. The top node of the array is not used. Each sub-node is subscripted by the index of the form variable from the <var>pFormVarNames</var> list that it corresponds to. The value at that subscript is the form data for that variable. For single-valued form variables this value is just the value. In this case this node should have no sub-nodes. For multiple valued form variables, the value at this node should be the count of form variable values, and each of the values for this form variable should appear in a sub-node, subscripted by its position in the node. For special needs, the <var>pHttpRequestIn</var> argument can be used to pre-populate properties of the %Net.HTTPRequest object used to send the HTTP request.

Class.name: DLS.REST.Example.BPL
Class.Description: Example BPL to demonstrate usage of DLS.REST.Operation

XData.name: BPL

Class.name: DLS.REST.Example.InboundAdapter
Class.Description: Example Inbound Adapter to demonstrate DLS.REST.Operation usage

Parameter.name: SERVICEINPUTCLASS
Parameter.Description: Set the class that will be returned as Input to our Service

Method.name: OnTask

Class.name: DLS.REST.Example.Service
Class.Description: Example service to demonstrate DLS.REST.Operation usage

Property.name: TargetConfigNames
Property.Description: Configuration item(s) to which to send messages

Method.name: OnProcessInput
OnGetConnections
Method.Description: Return an array of connections for drawing lines on the config diagram

Class.name: DLS.REST.OperationV2
Class.Description:
Extension of EnsLib.REST.Operation that uses DLS.HTTP.OutboundAdapter to Allow setting of Content Type as well as some other common features.
It expects to be passed a DLS.REST.Request containing either a FormVariables string or a JSON payload It returns a DLS.REST.Response containing the ServerResponse string
Developers should aim to handle the request/response through the BPL logic, however a few hooks are provided for situations where this needs to be done through the operation (for example utilizing the adapter's credentialsObj).

Parameter.name: ADAPTER
Parameter.Description: The outbound adapter used to handle our HTTP requests. Use this instead of EnsLib.HTTP.OutboundAdapter so we can set Content Type of POST requests to 'application/json'

Property.name: Action
Property.Description: The HTTP verb to be used when sending a REST request

Property.name: AttemptNumber
Property.Description: Flag used to track the number of attempts made

Method.name: PopulateFormVariables
Method.Description: Developers may override this method in order to pull form variables from the request message. The output string will be passed to the Adapter's Get(), Post(), Put(), or Delete() request as the pFormVarNames variable. See EnsLib.HTTP.OutboundAdapter for further documentation.

Method.name: PopulatePayload
Method.Description: Developers may override this method in order to populate a payload object based on the values provided in the request message. The Object output by this method will be passed to the Adapter's Get(), Post(), Put(), or Delete() request as the pData variable. See EnsLib.HTTP.OutboundAdapter for further documentation.

Method.name: HandleResponse
Method.Description: Developers may override this method in order to update the Ens.Response message based on the data retreived from the Server. pServerResponse will be an object constructed from the JSON string that the server provided.

Method.name: RetryRequired
Method.Description: Developers may override this method in order to provide their own logic for determining whether another (potentially modified) request should be made to the REST endpoint. Any modifications to the payload or form variables on a retry should be handled via the PopulateFormVariables() and PopulatePayload() methods (with conditional logic based on the AttemptNumber)

Method.name: OnMessage
GetWithQueryParams
Method.Description: Construct URL with Form Variables appended as query params

Method.name: OnMessageProcessed
Method.Description: Reset after message has been processed

Class.name: DLS.REST.Request
Class.Description: Holds relevant information used to initiate a REST request

Class.name: DLS.REST.Response
Class.Description: Holds information passed back by the Server as a response to a REST request (Stored as a Cache Object)
